title: Calories in a Reese's Cup
meta_description: Learn calories in a Reese's cup, including full nutrition facts like carbs, fat, protein, sugars, and sodium for this peanut butter chocolate treat.
assumptions: Standard single milk chocolate peanut butter cup (21 g), no additional toppings or modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, and recipe; values based on average Hershey's Reese's Peanut Butter Cup. Check packaging for exact info.

quick_answer.text: A single Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 110 calories and 2.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: King size cup (double the standard size)

faqs.q: How many calories in a Reese's cup?
faqs.a: About 110 calories for one standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a Reese's cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 11 g total carbs, including 9 g sugars and 0.5 g fiber.

faqs.q: How much fat is in one Reese's cup?
faqs.a: 7 g total fat, with 3 g saturated fat per cup.

faqs.q: Are Reese's cups high in sodium?
faqs.a: One cup has about 85 mg sodium, which is moderate for a candy.

faqs.q: How does Reese's cup nutrition compare to other chocolates?
faqs.a: Higher in protein (2.5 g) due to peanut butter, but similar calories to many bite-sized chocolates.
